[

Critical Care Nurse - Intensive Care Unit

Company Name Epworth Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Leading world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group
  • Strong focus on patient centred care, research and education
  • Box Hill location, plans for future growth

Epworth Eastern

Located in Box Hill, Epworth Eastern is a state-of-the-art facility and includes a 8 bed ICU, 10 bed HDU/CCU and 10 theatres.

Epworth Eastern maintains a broad clinical focus from cardiac, vascular, orthopaedic and general surgery to oncology, urology and endoscopy services. From consultation and detection through to surgery, Epworth Eastern aims to work with patients and their families to ensure they have the best experience possible.

In 2018, the commencement of Epworth Eastern’s expansion and redevelopment project will grow the hospital and introduce a brand new emergency department to the region.

The Role

We are seeking experienced Critical Care Registered Nurses to join our dynamic team, who wish to be involved in providing excellence in clinical care within the Intensive Care Unit environment at Epworth Eastern. Our Intensive Care Unit (ICU) is a combined general ICU, high dependency and telemetry unit and is renowned for its friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere along with excellent care that is delivered to its patients.

Key areas of focus for this role include-
  • Delivering an exceptional patient experience within the Intensive Care Unit
  • Ensuring patient flow is managed whilst providing high standards of patient care
  • Encouraging and role-modelling empathy to patients, families and medical consultants


Skills & Experience

To be successful in the role you will-
  • Hold current nursing registration with AHPRA
  • Have completed or working towards a Post Graduate qualification in Critical/Intensive Care Nursing
  • Be currently employed in a critical care setting
  • Be able to demonstrate nursing experience in a critical care area
  • Be highly accountable and demonstrate a strong, supportive and engaging style
  • Be passionate about patient care and achieving high quality clinical outcomes


About Epworth

Epworth HealthCare is a world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group dedicated to providing the best possible outcomes for our patients by providing the best possible care. Across our eight locations patients and staff have access to state-of-the-art diagnostic, surgical and procedural technology, world-class theatres and equipment and benefit from the extensive teaching and research occurring at Epworth every day.

The Epworth Difference is defined by our unique culture and dedication to giving outstanding patient care. From the way we recognise and reward our staff to our attitude toward the patient experience, Epworth is for those with the ambition to get better, give the best possible care and lead their field.

Epworth is a great choice for staff who want to be part of a cutting-edge, fast paced and progressive environment.

Enquire/Apply for this Position

To obtain more information refer to the attached position description.

Direct your enquiries to the contact person listed below.

Applications must be submitted online – to apply for this position click Apply Now

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Epworth and a valid employee Working with Children Check to be provided by the applicant.

Note- Applications from Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Medical Practice
  • Hospital & Health Care

Full-time

Cloud DevOps Engineer

Company Name Ericsson Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 75 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Date: Sep 11, 2018

Cloud DevOps Engineer
What does your future look like?
Are you ready to take on enterprise and industry challenges at a global level? Are you excited to innovate in ways that are only beginning to become possible? Does the idea of being at the forefront of the ICT industry seem like an ideal career? If so, then Ericsson Digital Services is an excellent place for you to start your career.

We make networks more automated, more cost-efficient, and more programmable to reduce time-to-market and enable superior engagements. We’re evolving core networks into 5G, and creating revolutionary new approaches to prepare businesses for the next generation of mobile technology.
Working in Ericsson Digital Services is about looking to the future and understanding the implications of change for our customers. Our expertise is in helping operators and service providers become more integrated, more agile – and ready to make the most of future opportunities
As part of the Ericsson team, you too can be shaping the industry, by working on a diverse range of activities including systems integration, adaptation and customization, automation services to reduce the IT software development life cycle, service orchestration, development and maintenance of cloud infrastructure including virtualization and security. Coupled with this, you will also be working within project management, network consulting, and customer support.

Come and discover what makes YOU + ERICSSON a powerful combination
We welcome the opportunity to meet you!
http://www.ericsson.com/careers

Key Skills
  • Linux/Unix or Windows administration
    Linux (one or more)
    • RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu
      Windows
    • Windows Server
  • Networking, Firewall, Security
    • DNS, TCT/IP, Telnet, SSH, FTP, VPN
  • Virtualization software
    • WMWare Esxi (vSphere), VirtualBox, KVM, Hyper-V
  • Cloud Services
    • Network function virtualization (NFV) & Virtual Network Function (VNF)
    • Saas, Iaas, Paas, Caas, Xaas
  • Scripting
    Required (one or more)
    • Ruby, Shell, Perl, PHP, Python
  • Testing
    • Write automation test scripts.
    • Create automation tools or scripts that support testing infrastructure
    • Manage test infrastructure and execution of tests
  • Automation
    • Puppet, Salt, Chef, Ansible
    • Bamboo, Jenkins, Groovy
  • Containerisation
    • Docker, Rocket
    • Kubernetes, Docker Swarm

In This Role, You Will Be Responsible For
  • Reference designs, hands-on implementation, and day-to-day management of cloud automation code deliverables
  • Providing technical and subject matter expertise for establishing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery frameworks
  • Developing automation tools for deployment and testing of enterprise cloud platforms
  • Providing thought leadership in Cloud technology including virtualisation, hypervisors, storage and security.
  • Leading the solution analysis, solution design (and where required) leading local and offshore technical teams.
  • Lead and contribute with presentations and discussions in customer workshops, providing cloud business solutions and technical expertise.
  • Share and transfer knowledge, presenting to others on latest solutions and new releases.
  • Act as a role model and mentor for less experienced members of the team.

As Our Ideal Candidate, You Will Have
  • Tertiary qualification in Engineering/ICT or equivalent.
  • Experience with cloud-based provisioning, monitoring, troubleshooting, and related DevOps technologies.
  • Experience with manipulating APIs to programmatically automate manual tasks
  • Experience working within an Agile environment
  • Strong Linux experience.
  • Strong experience in infrastructure development including automation and scripting
  • Understanding of challenges faced by customers while transitioning to cloud technology.
  • Relevant certifications (e.g. VMWare, AWS, Cisco, Redhat) would be considered an advantage but not essential .
  • Experience gained within an IT, Consulting or Telco organisation
  • Strong people and communication skills.

Why Ericsson?

Ericsson offers a truly global company, with a diverse, performance-driven culture, an innovative and engaging environment and opportunities to work across borders. Our employees live our vision, core values and guiding principles – sharing a passion to win and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients.
In Australia, we are known for delivering “World-1st” projects for Australia's largest and most renowned telecommunications carriers. This is a chance to play a critical role in the success of the Ericsson organisation in Australia, whilst providing you with a fantastic career development opportunity and the chance to work alongside the brightest minds in our industry.
We invite you to join our team as we work together to solve the world’s biggest challenges.
Follow us social media –

LinkedIn

Twitter

Facebook

YouTube
We will not be providing a work permit/visa for this position

Please Note: We are only interested in applications from individuals and are not interested in any speculative calls or submissions from Recruitment Agencies.

865166966:
[

Maintenance & Engineering Manager - Castrol, Spotswood

Company Name BP Company Location Spotswood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 280 views

Job description


As part of BP, Castrol is widely acknowledged as the world's leading specialist provider of Lubricant solutions. Although best known for our expertise in developing lubricants for the auto, Industrial and resource sectors, we also produce lubricants that directly affect our daily lives in other ways such as in gas and electricity production, transport industries, construction, and the marine sector.

We are now recruiting for a Maintenance & Engineering Manager to join our team at our Spotswood lubricant production plant.

Reporting to the Plant Manager, the primary purpose of this role is to safely lead and manage the inspection and maintenance resources, including contractors, in the plant and to provide effective leadership of people, plant and processes to drive an important change agenda in order to deliver business objectives. This change program will require someone with a strong continuous improvement mindset, ideally coupled with Six Sigma/Lean qualifications and experience.



Key Responsibilities:



* Ensuring all maintenance and engineering activities are performed in adherence to company and regulatory policies and standards
* Maintaining the facility such that no harm to people, the environment, or damage to equipment occurs
* Leading a continuous improvement agenda focusing on people and process performance improvement
* Participating in HSSE audits and risk assessments
* Supporting activities that minimise waste and reduce energy consumption
* Budget management
* Maintain & administer the Computerised Maintenance Management System
* Contractor Management
* Provide input into the formulation of the 5 year and annual capital plan
* Develop a reliability centred maintenance plan to support business continuity
* Implement outstanding statutory engineering standards
* Establish, maintain & administer an engineering support network to provide supplementary engineering support for Company specific projects and requirements


Essential Qualifications, Skills & Experience:

In order to be considered for this role, applicants must; be a degree qualified engineer (Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical preferred); have previously led a transformation agenda within a manufacturing environment (e.g. ERP or CMMS implementation, safety or cultural change); have outstanding contractor and budget management skills and; be a capable people leader who is able to cleverly influence across all levels of the organisation.

Interested applicants should aspire to broader roles within the organisation and seek to advance both horizontally and vertically over the next three to seven years.

This is a safety critical role at our plant and only those who meet all of the above criteria can be considered for this important role.

Industry

  • Oil & Energy

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
]

865970424:
[

Videographer

Company Name Xero Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 71 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Xero


At Xero we are rewiring the small business economy and want millions of small businesses to thrive through beautiful software, advice and connections. We aim to make being a small business more efficient and profitable for small business owners, and more enjoyable too. \xa0

Xero has been rated by Canstar Blue as Australia’s best accounting software for the last four years.

\xa0

The opportunity


We’re currently recruiting for a talented and creative Melbourne-based Videographer to help manage the AU video production and motion graphics.


We’re looking for someone with a real strength in post-production and editing including confidence in using After Effects. \xa0Equally, you’ll possess the ability to plan, shoot and edit a story quickly and to a high standard with little direction whilst adapting to a fast changing environment and possessing an understanding for design driven thinking. If you like a challenge - this role might just be for you!

\xa0

What you’ll do


  • Shooting and editing beautiful video content for use across social and digital channels.
  • Delivering content to specific formats based on current best practice for paid ad campaigns
  • Assisting with video production planning and execution for key events (Xerocon, Road Shows etc.)
  • Developing titles, graphics, motion graphics and visual effects to integrate with video content
  • Filming and editing software release updates and product shots
  • Collaborating creatively with the Design and Marketing teams to understand the business objectives, customer requirements, target audience and context of the video to enable you to produce authentic and human content.
  • Collaborating on storyboards, scripts, graphics, images and audio to pre-visualise video concepts and prepare shot lists, props, scripts, wardrobe, and supporting images.
  • Coordinating and scheduling video shoots: transportation, gear, people, props, and wardrobe along with creating videos that are consistent with Xero’s brand values.

\xa0

What you’ll bring \xa0


Critical competencies

  • Demonstrable abilities with video & motion graphics and \xa0audio production in a fast paced environment
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
  • An ability to give clear instructions and to comprehend the requirements of the projects assigned
  • An ability to collaborate with a team of people involved in the creation of the video’s production
  • Creativity and craftsmanship, with an ability to quickly understand the Xero brand and culture, to ensure all content and output is consistent with the Xero style
  • Commercial acumen to guide day-to-day decision making and prioritisation
  • Ability to identify talent as well as being able to draw the best out of characters (actors/speakers/participants)

\xa0

Experience

  • Extensive knowledge of video and audio recording equipment, including cameras (DSLR), storage devices, microphones, tripods, lights and other related devices
  • A talent and flair in using Adobe editing products such as Premier Pro, Photoshop and After Effects

\xa0

At Xero, we are proud of our collaborative, empowering and inclusive culture that allows creativity to thrive and innovation to flourish.


If you meet the above criteria and want to work for a business that enables its employees to do the best work of their lives, then we’d like to hear from you.


Apply today.

Job description

Founded in 2004, McGrathNicol is a dynamic Advisory and Restructuring firm trusted by blue chip clients to partner with them to devise and implement pragmatic solutions for complex business issues.

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an experienced Assistant Manager level candidate to join the national Transactions team, based in our Melbourne office. Our Transactions team provides corporate, private equity and banking clients with quality, independent and objective transaction advice including due diligence, deal support and transaction/post transaction project management.

The successful candidate will:

  • be CA qualified with recent experience in Transactions, Corporate Finance or Audit, preferably within a Big 4 or boutique accounting firm;
  • have an impeccable eye for detail and superior communication skills (both written and verbal);
  • demonstrate proven people management capabilities, with experience in supervising junior team members;
  • possess a strong commitment to delivering on client outcomes;
  • demonstrate commitment to personal and professional development; and
  • be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

You will also be able to demonstrate excellent presentation, problem solving and analytical skills, along with commercial acumen and a strong team focus.\xa0

In return we offer a dynamic environment where employees are rewarded for their hard work through our annual bonus program. Other benefits include excellent training and career development opportunities, personalised mentorship, postgraduate study support, and the opportunity to work alongside some of the best practitioners in the field.

SENIOR GAME ARTIST | ART DIRECTOR - SMG STUDIO - CONTRACT TILL OCTOBER

Company Name Soap Creative Group Company Location Cecil St, South Melbourne Victoria 3205

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 23 views

Job description

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY


Our games: Thumb Drift, OTTTD, One More Line, One More Dash, RISK & Death Squared


You will have the opportunity to work on high-profile entertainment IP as well as our original IP, while helping shaping the future of the studio.

We're looking for someone with right skills and a good attitude to come in and make kick ass games with us.


What you will do:


  • Lead the concepting and production of art for a range of mobile and console titles.
  • Produce high quality 2D, 3D and VFX assets in a variety of styles.
  • Produce good quality sketches to explain and sell game concepts.
  • Drive the creation of art and ensure that a unified vision is maintained.
  • Find artistic solutions which balance creative vision with production realities.
  • Review other artists’ work and give feedback to ensure highest quality output is met.
  • Collaborate with programmers to develop efficient and productive art pipelines.
  • Work with producers to ensure that realistic schedules are created and adhered to.
  • Be an active mentor and role model for the team.
  • Work to maintain morale and create an atmosphere of creativity and enthusiasm.
  • Keep informed about latest advances in game art techniques and technology.
  • Drive creation of presentation and marketing materials to communicate the artistic vision of our games.
  • Maintain contact with the Sydney Studio to offer expertise and advice where needed.
  • Be actively involved with recruitment, vetting candidates, performing interviews & recommending hires.
  • Develop the skills of other team members and raise the quality bar within the studio.


ABOUT YOU:


  • Diploma/Degree in 2D/3D video game development or equivalent training/experience.
  • 5 years’ experience with minimum of 2 years at senior level or above.
  • Experience of working on a published game from conception to release.
  • Strong portfolio demonstrating a high level of artistic creativity in one or more game art disciplines across a range of styles.
  • Expert knowledge of Photoshop.
  • Ability to quickly sketch ideas and concepts.
  • Good understanding of latest techniques in 3D modeling.
  • Good knowledge of latest 3D software, preferably Maya.
  • Technical mindset with experience of implementing assets in game engines.
  • Understanding of fundamental art theory including principles of color, light, composition and anatomy.
  • Proven ability to balance esthetics with performance and usability.
  • Ability to present clear documentation communicating ideas both internally and externally.


\xa0Other Skills:


  • Positive influence and leadership skills.
  • Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
  • Motivates and inspires others to generate new ideas.
  • Good organization skills. Anticipates, prioritizes and plans own work.
  • Good coaching skills.
  • Considerable understanding of video games and broad video game culture.
  • Self-motivated and agile.

\xa0

INTERESTED?
\xa0
Great, just send us your CV, a portfolio and anything else that you think we would find interesting – and if we think we would like working together then we will give you a call.


At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so. \xa0For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures
